title: Req→Ack within 1–3 cycles — write a concurrent SVA
description:
Scenario: A bus request should be acknowledged shortly after it's asserted, otherwise a bug occurred. Write a concurrent SVA that checks 'req' implies 'ack' within 1–3 cycles and is disabled during reset.

Diagram:
  clk: ↑   ↑   ↑
  req: 1   0   0
  ack: 0   1   0

Explain why 'disable iff (reset)' is important.

examples.input: assert property (@(posedge clk) disable iff (reset) (req |-> ##[1:3] ack));
examples.output: Checks that whenever req is true, ack follows within 1 to 3 clock cycles; assertion ignored while reset is asserted.
examples.explanation: This is a concurrent assertion (temporal) with 'disable iff' guarding reset.

constraints: Signals must be sampled on the same clock domain.
hints: Concurrent assertions express temporal relationships across cycles.

solution.code:
property p_req_ack; @(posedge clk) disable iff (reset) (req |-> ##[1:3] ack); endproperty
assert property (p_req_ack) else $error("Req->Ack not observed within 1..3 cycles");
